intro: Tannodia tenuifolia var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf tanniodia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
